title: TypeScript Basics for Angular
subject: Angular
theory: Angular is built with TypeScript. TS adds static typing, classes, interfaces, and decorators to JS. Decorators (like @Component) are crucial in Angular for attaching metadata to classes.

examples.explanation: Classes model business logic in Angular components and services.

common_mistakes.correction: Using 'any' everywhere defeats the purpose of TS.
common_mistakes.example: let data: any; // Avoid if possible

interview_questions.question: Why does Angular use TypeScript?
interview_questions.answer: For static typing, better tooling, refactoring capabilities, and compile-time error checking.

exam_notes: Decorators are a key TS feature used heavily.
summary: TypeScript provides the safety and structure needed for large Angular applications.
